metadata.title: CVE-2023-39194 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the XFRM subsystem in the Linux kernel. The specificflaw exists within the processing of state filters, which can result in aread past the end of an allocated buffer. This flaw allows a localprivileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read,potentially leading to an information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-220-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-220-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-220-lowlatency - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-kvm - 4.4.0-1126.136
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1163-aws - 4.4.0-1163.178
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-aws - 4.15.0-1163.176~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-azure - 4.15.0-1172.187~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-gcp - 4.15.0-1157.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1126-oracle - 4.15.0-1126.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-248.282').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.136').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1163.178').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.176~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.187~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1095.102').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.174~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1126.137~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
